content: This report highlights the Department of Defense's alternative fuel initiatives, including testing, evaluation, and certification of alternative fuels for service fleets. The Navy is collaborating with other agencies to promote domestic advanced biofuel production. The services have collectively spent around $48 million on these efforts. The Navy, along with other government agencies, plans to boost domestic biofuel production using the Defense Production Act. The services have invested $48 million in alternative fuels and the Navy is proposing a $170 million investment in biofuel production capacity. DOD spent approximately $17.3 billion on petroleum fuels in FY2011. This report provides an overview of DOD's alternative fuels policy and purchases. The report provides an overview of DOD's alternative fuels policy, purchases, testing platforms, certification of fuel blends, and the Navy's biofuel production initiative under the Defense Production Act. It also discusses recent legislative actions related to DOD alternative fuels. The Navy's biofuel production initiative under the Defense Production Act, in conjunction with the Department of Energy and Agriculture, and recent legislative actions related to DOD alternative fuels efforts are discussed, along with appropriated funding. For more details on the Navy's biofuel production efforts under the Defense Production Act, refer to CRS Report R42568.
